title: Environmental Information Management System (EIMS)
description: Designed end-to-end architecture for UNDP/GEF Environmental Information Management System supporting Pakistan's Ministry of Climate Change.
fullDescription: A centralized platform for environmental data analytics developed in collaboration with UNDP, GEF, and Pakistan's Ministry of Climate Change. The system aggregates multi-source environmental data to support evidence-based policy decisions for climate resilience and sustainable development.
problem: Environmental data was siloed across agencies and formats, making it difficult for policymakers to access actionable insights for climate change mitigation.
constraints: Must support multiple stakeholder groups with varying technical capabilities. Required data import from diverse external sources with different formats and quality levels.
approach: Designed comprehensive SRS, database schema, and system architecture. Built data import/export modules, role-based dashboards, and automated aggregation pipelines.
tradeoffs: Chose pragmatic technology stack (MySQL, web-based portal) for maintainability by government teams. Prioritized data accessibility over advanced analytics features.
execution: 3-month fixed-term contract. Delivered complete system design, functional requirements, and documentation for multi-stakeholder implementation.
outcomes: Enhanced accessibility to critical environmental information. Supported data-driven policy decisions aligned with UN Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs).
whatIdImprove: Would have pushed for more modern cloud infrastructure to support future scalability.
